images.caption: Figure 1:Lung opacity often increases with COVID severityLeft to right: normal, moderate and severe levels of opacity in lung CXRs of patients with COVID.
Figure 2:Distribution of opacity scores for each of the three datasets combined in this study, shown in stacked histogram form.
Figure 3:Confusion Matrix of the DenseNet161 Testset (20% of dataset).

Figure 4:Examples of saliency maps generated in this study.Examples of better (top) and worse (bottom) regression predictions show that model gradients are different for different images, suggesting that the model is focusing on different regions. Yellow denotes zones that affect the modelâ€™s gradients more when the image is run through the model. Actual and predicted opacity scores are given above the image. Images shown here were generated with the DenseNet-all model.
